trans-unit.source: pageTitle="Azure Authenticator for Android | Microsoft Azure"
trans-unit.target: pageTitle="Azure Authenticator for Android | Microsoft Azure"

trans-unit.source: description="Microsoft Azure Authenticator app can be used to sign-in to access work resources.
trans-unit.target: description="Microsoft Azure Authenticator app can be used to sign-in to access work resources.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Authenticator app notifies you of a pending two-factor verification request by displaying an alert to your mobile device."
trans-unit.target: The Azure Authenticator app notifies you of a pending two-factor verification request by displaying an alert to your mobile device."

trans-unit.source: Azure Authenticator for Android
trans-unit.target: Azure Authenticator for Android

trans-unit.source: Your IT administrator may have recommended you to use the Microsoft Azure Authenticator to sign-in to access your work resources.
trans-unit.target: Your IT administrator may have recommended you to use the Microsoft Azure Authenticator to sign-in to access your work resources.

trans-unit.source: This application provides these two sign-in options:
trans-unit.target: This application provides these two sign-in options:

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication allows you to secure your work or school accounts with two-step verification.
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication allows you to secure your work or school accounts with two-step verification.

trans-unit.source: You sign-in using something you know (for example, your password) and protect the account even further with something you have (a security key from this app).
trans-unit.target: You sign-in using something you know (for example, your password) and protect the account even further with something you have (a security key from this app).

trans-unit.source: The Azure Authenticator app notifies you of a pending two-factor verification request by displaying an alert to your mobile device.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Authenticator app notifies you of a pending two-factor verification request by displaying an alert to your mobile device.

trans-unit.source: You need to simply view the request in the app and tap verify or cancel.
trans-unit.target: You need to simply view the request in the app and tap verify or cancel.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, you may be prompted to enter the passcode displayed in the app.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, you may be prompted to enter the passcode displayed in the app.

trans-unit.source: Work Account allows you to turn your Android phone or tablet into a trusted device and provide Single Sign-On (SSO) to company applications.
trans-unit.target: Work Account allows you to turn your Android phone or tablet into a trusted device and provide Single Sign-On (SSO) to company applications.

trans-unit.source: Your IT administrator may require you to add a work account in order to access company resources.
trans-unit.target: Your IT administrator may require you to add a work account in order to access company resources.

trans-unit.source: SSO lets you sign in once and automatically avail of signing in across all applications your company has made available to you.
trans-unit.target: SSO lets you sign in once and automatically avail of signing in across all applications your company has made available to you.

trans-unit.source: Installing the Azure Authenticator app
trans-unit.target: Installing the Azure Authenticator app

trans-unit.source: You can install the Azure Authenticator app from Google Play Store.
trans-unit.target: You can install the Azure Authenticator app from Google Play Store.

trans-unit.source: The instructions to add work account from Samsung Android device vs a non-Samsung Android device are slightly different.
trans-unit.target: The instructions to add work account from Samsung Android device vs a non-Samsung Android device are slightly different.

trans-unit.source: The instructions for both are listed below.
trans-unit.target: The instructions for both are listed below.

trans-unit.source: Adding the work account from Samsung Android device
trans-unit.target: Adding the work account from Samsung Android device

trans-unit.source: Adding the work account through the app home screen
trans-unit.target: Adding the work account through the app home screen

trans-unit.source: The following instructions are applicable to Samsung GS3 and above phones or Note2 and above tablets.
trans-unit.target: The following instructions are applicable to Samsung GS3 and above phones or Note2 and above tablets.

trans-unit.source: On the home screen of the app, accept the end user license agreement (EULA).
trans-unit.target: On the home screen of the app, accept the end user license agreement (EULA).

trans-unit.source: On the Activate Account screen, click the context menu on the right and select Work account.
trans-unit.target: On the Activate Account screen, click the context menu on the right and select Work account.

trans-unit.source: On the Add Account screen, select* Work Account*.
trans-unit.target: On the Add Account screen, select* Work Account*.

trans-unit.source: On Activate device administrator screen, click Activate.
trans-unit.target: On Activate device administrator screen, click Activate.

trans-unit.source: On the Privacy Policy screen, select the checkbox and click Confirm.
trans-unit.target: On the Privacy Policy screen, select the checkbox and click Confirm.

trans-unit.source: On the Workplace Join screen, enter the userID provided by your organization and click Join.
trans-unit.target: On the Workplace Join screen, enter the userID provided by your organization and click Join.

trans-unit.source: To sign in to the Azure Authenticator app, enter your organizational a**ccount and password and click **Sign in.
trans-unit.target: To sign in to the Azure Authenticator app, enter your organizational a**ccount and password and click **Sign in.

trans-unit.source: The next screen that displays information about multi-factor authentication (MFA) is for added security and is optional.
trans-unit.target: The next screen that displays information about multi-factor authentication (MFA) is for added security and is optional.

trans-unit.source: You will see this screen if your work or school requires second-factor authentication for creating work account.
trans-unit.target: You will see this screen if your work or school requires second-factor authentication for creating work account.

trans-unit.source: It provides instructions to further verify your account.
trans-unit.target: It provides instructions to further verify your account.

trans-unit.source: The Workplace Join screen displays the message, “Joining your workplace”.
trans-unit.target: The Workplace Join screen displays the message, “Joining your workplace”.

trans-unit.source: The Azure authenticator app is attempting to join your device to your workplace.
trans-unit.target: The Azure authenticator app is attempting to join your device to your workplace.

trans-unit.source: You should see the Workplace Joined message on the next screen.
trans-unit.target: You should see the Workplace Joined message on the next screen.

trans-unit.source: You are allowed a single work account on your device.
trans-unit.target: You are allowed a single work account on your device.

trans-unit.source: Adding the work account from the settings menu
trans-unit.target: Adding the work account from the settings menu

trans-unit.source: After you have installed the Azure Authenticator app, you can also create a work account from the Android Account Manager.
trans-unit.target: After you have installed the Azure Authenticator app, you can also create a work account from the Android Account Manager.

trans-unit.source: From the Settings menu, navigate to Accounts and click Add Account.
trans-unit.target: From the Settings menu, navigate to Accounts and click Add Account.

trans-unit.source: Follow steps 3-10 in the procedure, Adding the work account through the app home screen, to add a work account.
trans-unit.target: Follow steps 3-10 in the procedure, Adding the work account through the app home screen, to add a work account.

trans-unit.source: Adding the work account from a non-Samsung Android device
trans-unit.target: Adding the work account from a non-Samsung Android device

trans-unit.source: Adding the work account through the app home screen
trans-unit.target: Adding the work account through the app home screen

trans-unit.source: On the home screen of the app, accept the end user license agreement (EULA).
trans-unit.target: On the home screen of the app, accept the end user license agreement (EULA).

trans-unit.source: On the Activate Account screen, click the context menu on the right and select Work account.
trans-unit.target: On the Activate Account screen, click the context menu on the right and select Work account.

trans-unit.source: On the Accounts screen, click Add Account.
trans-unit.target: On the Accounts screen, click Add Account.

trans-unit.source: If you see the Accounts screen, click Add account.
trans-unit.target: If you see the Accounts screen, click Add account.

trans-unit.source: If a work account is already created previously, you will see a Sync screen showing the existing work account.
trans-unit.target: If a work account is already created previously, you will see a Sync screen showing the existing work account.

trans-unit.source: You can retain the work account by simply tapping the back arrow to the home screen.
trans-unit.target: You can retain the work account by simply tapping the back arrow to the home screen.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, you can select the account to remove and recreate a new work account
trans-unit.target: Alternately, you can select the account to remove and recreate a new work account

trans-unit.source: On the Workplace Join screen, enter the userID provided by your organization and click Join.
trans-unit.target: On the Workplace Join screen, enter the userID provided by your organization and click Join.

trans-unit.source: To sign in to the Azure Authenticator app, enter your organizational account and password and click Sign in.
trans-unit.target: To sign in to the Azure Authenticator app, enter your organizational account and password and click Sign in.

trans-unit.source: The next screen that displays information about multi-factor authentication (MFA) is for added security and is optional.
trans-unit.target: The next screen that displays information about multi-factor authentication (MFA) is for added security and is optional.

trans-unit.source: You will see this screen if your work or school requires second-factor authentication for creating work account.
trans-unit.target: You will see this screen if your work or school requires second-factor authentication for creating work account.

trans-unit.source: It provides instructions to further verify your account.
trans-unit.target: It provides instructions to further verify your account.

trans-unit.source: Click OK on the next screen.
trans-unit.target: Click OK on the next screen.

trans-unit.source: Do not change the certificate name.
trans-unit.target: Do not change the certificate name.

trans-unit.source: the message, “Joining your workplace”.
trans-unit.target: the message, “Joining your workplace”.

trans-unit.source: The Azure authenticator app is attempting to join your device to your workplace.
trans-unit.target: The Azure authenticator app is attempting to join your device to your workplace.

trans-unit.source: You should see the Workplace Joined message on the next screen.
trans-unit.target: You should see the Workplace Joined message on the next screen.

trans-unit.source: You are allowed a single work account on your device.
trans-unit.target: You are allowed a single work account on your device.

trans-unit.source: After you have installed the Azure Authenticator app, you can also create a work account from the Android Account Manager.
trans-unit.target: After you have installed the Azure Authenticator app, you can also create a work account from the Android Account Manager.

trans-unit.source: From the Settings menu, navigate to Accounts and click **Add Account.
trans-unit.target: From the Settings menu, navigate to Accounts and click **Add Account.

trans-unit.source: Follow steps 2-7 in the procedure, Adding the work account through the app home screen**, to add a work account.
trans-unit.target: Follow steps 2-7 in the procedure, Adding the work account through the app home screen**, to add a work account.

trans-unit.source: How to find out which version is installed
trans-unit.target: How to find out which version is installed

trans-unit.source: You can find out which version of the Azure Authenticator app and associated service versions are installed on your device.
trans-unit.target: You can find out which version of the Azure Authenticator app and associated service versions are installed on your device.

trans-unit.source: From the pop up menu, click About.
trans-unit.target: From the pop up menu, click About.

trans-unit.source: The About screen displays the services of the app and the versions installed on your device.
trans-unit.target: The About screen displays the services of the app and the versions installed on your device.

trans-unit.source: Sending log files to report issues
trans-unit.target: Sending log files to report issues

trans-unit.source: Follow the guidance on Microsoft Support to report an incident with the Azure Authenticator app, obtain an incident number, and send log files against the assigned incident number as follows:
trans-unit.target: Follow the guidance on Microsoft Support to report an incident with the Azure Authenticator app, obtain an incident number, and send log files against the assigned incident number as follows:

trans-unit.source: From the pop up menu, click Logging.
trans-unit.target: From the pop up menu, click Logging.

trans-unit.source: If you have an open incident with Microsoft Support, make note of the incident number (you'll need it for a later step).
trans-unit.target: If you have an open incident with Microsoft Support, make note of the incident number (you'll need it for a later step).

trans-unit.source: If you have not already created a support incident and would like assistance, follow the guidance at <link><linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title></link> to open a new incident.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already created a support incident and would like assistance, follow the guidance at <link><linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title></link> to open a new incident.

trans-unit.source: On the logging screen, click Send Now.
trans-unit.target: On the logging screen, click Send Now.

trans-unit.source: Select the email provider you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select the email provider you want to use.

trans-unit.source: If you already have an open incident Microsoft Support, contact the Support Engineer assigned to your issue to find out how to send the log data and have it associated with your incident.
trans-unit.target: If you already have an open incident Microsoft Support, contact the Support Engineer assigned to your issue to find out how to send the log data and have it associated with your incident.

trans-unit.source: The Support Engineer will provide you with information for the email address and subject line.
trans-unit.target: The Support Engineer will provide you with information for the email address and subject line.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have a support incident, please follow the guidance at Microsoft Support to open a new incident.
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have a support incident, please follow the guidance at Microsoft Support to open a new incident.

trans-unit.source: Edit the To line and Subject line with the information you have received from Microsoft Support.
trans-unit.target: Edit the To line and Subject line with the information you have received from Microsoft Support.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Authenticator app attaches the log file to the email you are sending.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Authenticator app attaches the log file to the email you are sending.

trans-unit.source: Describe the problem you are experiencing, update recipient list (optional), and send the email.
trans-unit.target: Describe the problem you are experiencing, update recipient list (optional), and send the email.

trans-unit.source: Deleting the work account and leaving your workplace
trans-unit.target: Deleting the work account and leaving your workplace

trans-unit.source: You can remove the work account you created at any time as follows:
trans-unit.target: You can remove the work account you created at any time as follows:

trans-unit.source: To delete the work account from the Settings menu
trans-unit.target: To delete the work account from the Settings menu

trans-unit.source: From the accounts manager, select Work account.
trans-unit.target: From the accounts manager, select Work account.

trans-unit.source: On the Work Account screen, in General Settings, select Account Settings – Leave your workplace network.
trans-unit.target: On the Work Account screen, in General Settings, select Account Settings – Leave your workplace network.

trans-unit.source: Select Leave on the Workplace Join screen.
trans-unit.target: Select Leave on the Workplace Join screen.

trans-unit.source: Click OK when the message “Are you sure you want to leave workplace” is displayed.
trans-unit.target: Click OK when the message “Are you sure you want to leave workplace” is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that you have deleted your work account from your workplace.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that you have deleted your work account from your workplace.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE>
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE>

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you do not use the Remove Account option to delete a work account as this option might not work in some earlier versions of Android.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you do not use the Remove Account option to delete a work account as this option might not work in some earlier versions of Android.

trans-unit.source: Uninstalling the app
trans-unit.target: Uninstalling the app

trans-unit.source: On a Samsung Android device, device administrator privileges must be removed as follows prior to uninstalling the
trans-unit.target: On a Samsung Android device, device administrator privileges must be removed as follows prior to uninstalling the

trans-unit.source: From Settings, under System, select Security.
trans-unit.target: From Settings, under System, select Security.

trans-unit.source: Within Device Administration, click Device administrators.
trans-unit.target: Within Device Administration, click Device administrators.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the check box next to Azure Authenticator is cleared.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the check box next to Azure Authenticator is cleared.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: If you see the Keystore Error, this could be because you don’t have the lock screen set up with a PIN.
trans-unit.target: If you see the Keystore Error, this could be because you don’t have the lock screen set up with a PIN.

trans-unit.source: To work around this issue, uninstall the Azure Authenticator app, configure a PIN for your lock screen, and reinstall the app.
trans-unit.target: To work around this issue, uninstall the Azure Authenticator app, configure a PIN for your lock screen, and reinstall the app.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
